sentences.sContent: The man focused some binoculars on the green peninsula ahead .
sentences.sContent_eng: The man focused some binoculars on the green peninsula ahead .
sentences.sCn: 男人拿起双筒望远镜眺望前面那青翠的半岛。

sentences.sContent: He raised the binoculars to his eye again, scanning across the scene.
sentences.sContent_eng: He raised the binoculars to his eye again, scanning across the scene.
sentences.sCn: 他再一次把双筒望远镜举到眼前，仔细观察整个现场。

sentences.sContent: Practice thesepaths several times with binoculars, and then repeat the one which works bestfor you using the finder of your telescope.
sentences.sContent_eng: Practice thesepaths several times with binoculars, and then repeat the one which works bestfor you using the finder of your telescope.
sentences.sCn: 用双筒望远镜练习这些路径几次，然后使用你的望远镜的寻星镜重复最适合的一个路径。

remMethod.val: bin(o)(双，两) + ocul(眼睛) + ars → 两只眼睛 → 双筒望远镜

trans.tranOther: a pair of special glasses, that you hold up to your eyes to look at objects that are a long distance away
